etymologies: late Middle English: from Latin receptaculum, from receptare ‘receive back’, frequentative of recipere (see receive)

definitions: an object or space used to contain something
shortDefinitions: hollow object used to contain something

definitions: an electrical outlet into which the plug of an electrical device may be inserted.
an organ or structure which receives a secretion, eggs, sperm, etc.
shortDefinitions: organ or structure which receives secretion, eggs, sperm

definitions: an enlarged area at the apex of a stem that bears the organs of a flower or the florets of a flower head.
shortDefinitions: enlarged area at apex of stem on which parts of flower or florets of flower head are inserted

definitions: a structure supporting the sexual organs in some algae, mosses, and liverworts.
shortDefinitions: structure supporting sexual organs in some algae and liverworts
